alert.note: Alert for Boulder (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 4:57PM MDT until July 06 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Boulder County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 800 PM MDT. * At 457 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.30 to 0.75 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly Calwood burn area of North Central Boulder County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.75 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy rainfall will cause flash flooding of creeks, streams, and ditches in the Calwood burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected. The main areas of concern are Heil Valley Ranch and Lefthand Creek just above US 36.
